intro: Tofieldia alpina, commonly known as the alpine tofieldia, is a flowering plant native to the northern regions of North America. It is a member of the Xanthorrhoeaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Tofieldia alpina typically grows in moist, sandy soils in alpine and subalpine environments. It is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or open areas at high elevations.
